contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Refimprove|date=October 2007}} '''Robert Cutlar Fergusson''' (1768–1838) was a Scottish lawyer and politician. He was 17th Laird of the [[Dumfriesshire]] Fergussons, seated at [[Craigdarroch]] ([[Moniaive]], Dumfriesshire). He served as [[Attorney-General]] of [[Bengal]]; [[Member of Parliament|MP]] for the [[Kirkcudbright Stewartry (UK Parliament constituency)|Stewardtry of Kirkcudbright]], [[Judge Advocate General (United Kingdom)|Judge Advocate General]] and a [[Privy Councillor]]. The great Bengal entrepreneur [[Dwarkanath Tagore]] was apprenticed under him in 1810, and Fergusson was one of the 2 leading influences in his life.<ref>"History of the Adi Brahmo Samaj (1906)" p 27.</ref> {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=51539561}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Fergusson, Robert Cutlar | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Scottish lawyer and politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1768 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1838 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fergusson, Robert Cutlar}} [[Category:1768 births]] [[Category:1838 deaths]] [[Category:Scottish lawyers]] [[Category:Members of the Privy Council of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Members of the United Kingdom Parliament for Scottish constituencies]] [[Category:UK MPs 1826–1830]] [[Category:UK MPs 1830–1831]] [[Category:UK MPs 1831–1832]] [[Category:UK MPs 1832–1835]] [[Category:UK MPs 1835–1837]] [[Category:UK MPs 1837–1841]] {{Scotland-law-bio-stub}} {{Scotland-MP-stub}}
